statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Albany, N.Y. 80, Hartford 67
article.story: ALBANY, N.Y. (AP) -- Jamar Wilson scored 22 points and Albany tied a season-high with 12 3-pointers in an 80-67 America East victory over Hartford on Sunday. Albany (12-7, 5-2 AE) jumped out to a 17-6 lead in the opening eight minutes by making five of eight 3-point attempts against the Hawks' zone defense. Wilson, who had 13 first-half points, hit three long-range jumpers in that outburst. Hartford (9-10, AE 3-4) closed the gap to 17-15 behind the play of Bo Taylor, a 6-foot-5 senior who made 10 of 17 from the floor en route to a career-high 28 points. The Great Danes scored 18 of the game's next 21 points. Brent Wilson, who had 14 of his 18 points in the opening period, made one of his four 3-pointers to push the lead back to double figures. Jon Iati, who scored 16 off the bench, drilled another 3-pointer from the left wing. Jamar Wilson then made a conventional three-point play when he was fouled on a fastbreak layup for a 35-18 advantage with 2:26 left in the period. The Hawks cut a 17-point halftime deficit to 39-27 early in the second half. Taylor hit a slam dunk off a back-door play and Jaret Rosenberg nailed a 3-pointer. Albany responded with a 12-4 run. Iati nailed two long-range shots in that span. The Great Danes extended the lead to as much as 24 points with less than five minutes to play. Joe Zeglinski was the only other Hartford player in double figures with 14.
